docs.lead_paragraph: John Roberts has presided over a court that has been far too willing to undermine precedent and give the powerful a helping hand.

headline.main: The Activist Roberts Court, 10 Years In
headline.print_headline: Ten Years of an Activist Court

docs.abstract: Editorial looks back on ten years of Supreme Court under tenure of Chief Justice John Roberts Jr; cautions against viewing court as shifting leftward due to scattering of high-profile rulings, like those on same-sex marriage and Affordable Care Act; notes Roberts court has been one of the most business-friendly courts in decades, and it has shown willingness to undermine precedent in favor of the powerful.
docs.snippet: John Roberts has presided over a court that has been far too willing to undermine precedent and give the powerful a helping hand.

docs.lead_paragraph: The companies say new customers under the Affordable Care Act have been sicker than expected, while federal officials say they want the requests scaled back.

headline.main: Health Insurance Companies Seek Big Rate Increases for 2016
headline.print_headline: Insurers Seek Steep Increases in Plans’ Rates

docs.abstract: Heath insurance companies around United States are seeking rate increases between 20 and 40 percent, alleging their customers under Affordable Care Act are sicker than expected; federal officials say they intend to scale back requests, which threaten to put health insurance out of reach of many.
docs.snippet: The companies say new customers under the Affordable Care Act have been sicker than expected, while federal officials say they want the requests scaled back.

docs.lead_paragraph: The merger could be the first in a series of deals as the health insurance industry grapples with rising medical costs and seeks scale to achieve better pricing power.

headline.main: Aetna Agrees to Acquire Humana for $37 Billion in Cash and Stock

docs.abstract: Aetna reports agreement to buy rival Humana for $37 billion.
docs.snippet: The merger could be the first in a series of deals as the health insurance industry grapples with rising medical costs and seeks scale to achieve better pricing power.

byline.original: By CHAD BRAY and REED ABELSON

docs.lead_paragraph: Aetna Inc's $37 billion (24 billion pound) deal to buy smaller health insurer Humana Inc will face rigorous scrutiny from U.S. regulators, which antitrust experts said could also make other large-scale mergers in the sector more difficult.

headline.main: Aetna’s Humana Deal to Bring Scrutiny on Other Insurer Tie-Ups-Experts
headline.print_headline: Aetna’s Humana Deal to Bring Scrutiny on Other Insurer Tie-Ups-Experts

docs.snippet: Aetna Inc's $37 billion (24 billion pound) deal to buy smaller health insurer Humana Inc will face rigorous scrutiny from U.S. regulators, which antitrust experts said could also make other large-scale mergers in the sector more difficult.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than a third of the U.S. population has health coverage through an insurer that either wants to make a huge acquisition or is about to be swallowed up in one.
